result.execSummary:
The defendant Daniel Lee Zarda Jr was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Battery [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).
  • Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Forest County Clerk of Circuit Court

miscConds.notes:
The defendant must maintain/obtain full time employment/school that consists of at least 35 hrs/week.

When not full time employed/school, the defendant must apply for at least 3 jobs per week and report progress monthly to P&P with pertinent information in regards to applications.  The defendant must only apply for jobs qualified for - must accept any job offered - must not engage in any conduct that could result in the termination of his/her employment/school.

The defendant must maintain absolute sobriety.

The defendant may not consume or possess alcohol and no entry into any taverns, bars or similar establishments.

The defendant may not have any contact or affiliation with Brenda Short-Cornell and not to enter onto any premises owned or occupied by her.
The defendant must attend and successfully complete an anger management program.
The defendant must undergo an AODA assessment and follow thru with all recommendations.

supervisions.notes:
Same conditions as count #1 except no additional community service.
Concurrent with: Count #1

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Daniel Lee Zarda Jr

records.addlTxt: Defendant Daniel Lee Zarda in court with attorney Elizabeth F Svehlek.  Charles James Simono appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Called 9:16 AM. Here for revocation of probation. State - 132 days credit for time served. 9 months on each count in the FC jail, concurrent to each other. Makes final statement. Svehlek makes argument and asks for 6 months in FC jail on each count, concurrent to each other. Zarda with holds comment. Court reviews probation revocation paperwork, makes statement and sentences to the following: Count 1 & 4 - 9 months in FC jail on each case, concurrent to one another, credit for 134 days, huber allowed, convert money owed into civil judgment. Appeal rights given.
Sentencing hearing on revocation on September 28, 2018 at 09:00 am.
Sentencing hearing on revocation on September 28, 2018 at 09:00 am.
Sentencing hearing on revocation on September 14, 2018 at 11:30 am.
And Stipulation to Waive Appearance and Hearing
from DOC re: extending probation for 2 years

records.descr: Notice of court ordered financial obligations
Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Defendant Daniel Lee Zarda in court with attorney Mary L.R. Burns.  Defendant Daniel Lee Zarda in custody.  Charles James Simono appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Called at 11:38 AM, also called 15CM15 and 15CM16. Burns - resolved. State - have complied with victim notification requirements with no response - joint recommendation on 14CM242 - plead to #1 as alleged, #2 - DRI; 180 days jail with fine of $500 plus costs; on 15CM15 - g to counts #1 and #4 as alleged with remaining counts to be DRI, court costs on each count with probation for 2 years - consecutive to jail time on 14CM242; on 15CM16 - g to count #3 as alleged, remaioning counts to be DRI, same conditions and court costs on each count, withhold sentence and place on probation for 2 years - concurrent to 15CM15 and consecutive to jail time on 14CM242 with conditions of:  AODA and follow thru, anger management and follow thru, absolute sobriety, no alcohol and no entry into any bars, taverns or similar establishments, employment/school, 200 hours of community service, no contact or affiliation with the victim (BS) and not to enter onto any premises that the victim owns/occupies. Burns agrees - 15 days jail credit (stipulated) that it will be applied to jail time on 14CM242. Zarda pleads G to count #1 on 14CM242, G to counts #1 on and #4 on 15CM15 and G to count #3 on 15CM16. Court dismisses and reads in count #1 on 14CM242, counts #2, #3 and #5, counts#1, #2 and #4. Court has plea questionnaire, goes thru it, finds the defendant has freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived his constitutional rights by entering his plea and right to JT, accepts plea, adjudges guilty, proceed to sentencing. State makes final argument prior to sentencing - follow joint recommendation. Burns makes final argument prior to sentencing - follow joint recommendation. Zarda makes statement. Court sentences the defendant to the following: 14CM242 - 180 days in FC jail - huber and good time allowed - credit for 15 days, $500.00 fine plus costs - take money from 15CM15 and remaining due 60 days after release from incarceration/CO; 15CM15 - withhold sentence and place on probation for 2 years - consecutive to jail time on 14CM242,  with conditions of: AODA and follow thru, anger management and follow thru, maintain absolute sobriety, no possession or consumption of alcohol and no entry into any bars, taverns or similar establishments, maintain/obtain full time employment/school, 200 hours of community service (total), no contact or affiliation with victim B.S. and not to enter onto any premises owned or occupied by the victim, costs on each count - paid thru probation; 15CM16 - withhold sentence and place on probation for 2 years - concurrent to 15CM15 but consecutive to jail time on 14CM242, with same conditions as 15CM15 except no additional community service, costs - paid thru probation, right to appeal, no voting rights, no possession of firearms, right to appeal.

Attorney Mary L.R. Burns in court.  Charles James Simono appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Called at 1:43 PM. Also called 15CM15 and 15CM16. Burns - not sure where the defendant is for stated reasons. Court forfeits any bond posted and issues bench warrant, body only, on all three matters.

Defendant Daniel Lee Zarda in court with attorney Mary L.R. Burns.  Charles James Simono appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Called at 10:02 AM. Also called 15CM15 and 15CM16. Burns - would like to resolve all matters on same date and time, understands charges and penalties in all cases, waives reading, enters NG on all counts. Court continues bond, accepts pleas, set all matters for FPT.  Final pre-trial scheduled for April 13, 2015 at 01:15 pm.

records.descr: Application for specific judicial assign approved

records.addlTxt: Defendant Daniel Lee Zarda in court.  Charles James Simono appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Also called 15CM16. Called at 9:24 AM. State provides defendant with both complaints in court. Court reads charges and penalties and right to attorney and court appointted attorney. Zarda understands charges, wants an attorney, cannot afford his own and believes he will have Mary Burns. Court will recuse himself from these two cases and have them transferred administratively for judicial economy. Court continues bond on 15CM15 but State would like to add the condition of no contact with victim (BC). State - 15CM16 - $1000 signature bond, no consumption of alcohol, no entry into any bars or taverns and no contact with victim (BC).
No consumption of alcohol. No contact with victims
